Source code

  1. /*
  2. * PostgreSQL System Functions
  3. *
  4. * Copyright (c) 1996-2024, PostgreSQL Global Development Group
  5. *
  6. * src/backend/catalog/system_functions.sql
  7. *
  8. * This file redefines certain built-in functions that are impractical
  9. * to fully define in pg_proc.dat.  In most cases that's because they use
  10. * SQL-standard function bodies and/or default expressions.  The node
  11. * tree representations of those are too unreadable, platform-dependent,
  12. * and changeable to want to deal with them manually.  Hence, we put stub
  13. * definitions of such functions into pg_proc.dat and then replace them
  14. * here.  The stub definitions would be unnecessary were it not that we'd
  15. * like these functions to have stable OIDs, the same as other built-in
  16. * functions.
  17. *
  18. * This file also takes care of adjusting privileges for those functions
  19. * that should not have the default public-EXECUTE privileges.  (However,
  20. * a small number of functions that exist mainly to underlie system views
  21. * are dealt with in system_views.sql, instead.)
  22. *
  23. * Note: this file is read in single-user -j mode, which means that the
  24. * command terminator is semicolon-newline-newline; whenever the backend
  25. * sees that, it stops and executes what it's got.  If you write a lot of
  26. * statements without empty lines between, they'll all get quoted to you
  27. * in any error message about one of them, so don't do that.  Also, you
  28. * cannot write a semicolon immediately followed by an empty line in a
  29. * string literal (including a function body!) or a multiline comment.
  30. */


  33. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION lpad(text, integer)
  34. RETURNS text
  35. LANGUAGE sql
  36. IMMUTABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT COST 1
  37. RETURN lpad($1, $2, ' ');

  39. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION rpad(text, integer)
  40. RETURNS text
  41. LANGUAGE sql
  42. IMMUTABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT COST 1
  43. RETURN rpad($1, $2, ' ');

  45. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION "substring"(text, text, text)
  46. RETURNS text
  47. LANGUAGE sql
  48. IMMUTABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT COST 1
  49. RETURN substring($1, similar_to_escape($2, $3));

  51. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION bit_length(bit)
  52. RETURNS integer
  53. LANGUAGE sql
  54. IMMUTABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT COST 1
  55. RETURN length($1);

  57. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION bit_length(bytea)
  58. RETURNS integer
  59. LANGUAGE sql
  60. IMMUTABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT COST 1
  61. RETURN octet_length($1) * 8;

  63. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION bit_length(text)
  64. RETURNS integer
  65. LANGUAGE sql
  66. IMMUTABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT COST 1
  67. RETURN octet_length($1) * 8;

  74. AS 'drandom_normal';

  119. RETURNS interval
  120. LANGUAGE sql

  122. RETURN age(cast(current_date as timestamptz), $1);

  190. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION "overlaps"(timestamptz, timestamptz,
  191.   timestamptz, interval)
  192. RETURNS boolean
  193. LANGUAGE sql
  194. STABLE PARALLEL SAFE COST 1
  195. RETURN ($1, $2) overlaps ($3, ($3 + $4));

  197. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION "overlaps"(timestamptz, interval,
  198.   timestamptz, interval)
  199. RETURNS boolean
  200. LANGUAGE sql
  201. STABLE PARALLEL SAFE COST 1
  202. RETURN ($1, ($1 + $2)) overlaps ($3, ($3 + $4));

  271. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION pg_sleep_for(interval)
  272. RETURNS void
  273. LANGUAGE sql
  274. PARALLEL SAFE STRICT COST 1
  275. RETURN pg_sleep(extract(epoch from clock_timestamp() + $1) -
  276.                 extract(epoch from clock_timestamp()));

  278. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION pg_sleep_until(timestamptz)
  279. RETURNS void
  280. LANGUAGE sql
  281. PARALLEL SAFE STRICT COST 1
  282. RETURN pg_sleep(extract(epoch from $1) -
  283.                 extract(epoch from clock_timestamp()));

  285. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION pg_relation_size(regclass)
  286. RETURNS bigint
  287. LANGUAGE sql
  288. PARALLEL SAFE STRICT COST 1
  289. RETURN pg_relation_size($1, 'main');

  291. CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION obj_description(oid, name)
  292. RETURNS text
  293. LANGUAGE sql
  294. STABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT
  295. BEGIN ATOMIC
  296. select description from pg_description
  297.   where objoid = $1 and
  298.     classoid = (select oid from pg_class where relname = $2 and
  299.                 relnamespace = 'pg_catalog'::regnamespace) and
  300.     objsubid = 0;
  301. END;

  303. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION shobj_description(oid, name)
  304. RETURNS text
  305. LANGUAGE sql
  306. STABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT
  307. BEGIN ATOMIC
  308. select description from pg_shdescription
  309.   where objoid = $1 and
  310.     classoid = (select oid from pg_class where relname = $2 and
  311.                 relnamespace = 'pg_catalog'::regnamespace);
  312. END;

  314. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION obj_description(oid)
  315. RETURNS text
  316. LANGUAGE sql
  317. STABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT
  318. BEGIN ATOMIC
  319. select description from pg_description where objoid = $1 and objsubid = 0;
  320. END;

  322. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION col_description(oid, integer)
  323. RETURNS text
  324. LANGUAGE sql
  325. STABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT
  326. BEGIN ATOMIC
  327. select description from pg_description
  328.   where objoid = $1 and classoid = 'pg_class'::regclass and objsubid = $2;
  329. END;

  331. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION ts_debug(config regconfig, document text,
  332.     OUT alias text,
  333.     OUT description text,
  334.     OUT token text,
  335.     OUT dictionaries regdictionary[],
  336.     OUT dictionary regdictionary,
  337.     OUT lexemes text[])
  338. RETURNS SETOF record
  339. LANGUAGE sql
  340. STABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT
  341. BEGIN ATOMIC
  342. select
  343.     tt.alias AS alias,
  344.     tt.description AS description,
  345.     parse.token AS token,
  346.     ARRAY ( SELECT m.mapdict::regdictionary
  347.             FROM pg_ts_config_map AS m
  348.             WHERE m.mapcfg = $1 AND m.maptokentype = parse.tokid
  349.             ORDER BY m.mapseqno )
  350.     AS dictionaries,
  351.     ( SELECT mapdict::regdictionary
  352.       FROM pg_ts_config_map AS m
  353.       WHERE m.mapcfg = $1 AND m.maptokentype = parse.tokid
  354.       ORDER BY ts_lexize(mapdict, parse.token) IS NULL, m.mapseqno
  355.       LIMIT 1
  356.     ) AS dictionary,
  357.     ( SELECT ts_lexize(mapdict, parse.token)
  358.       FROM pg_ts_config_map AS m
  359.       WHERE m.mapcfg = $1 AND m.maptokentype = parse.tokid
  360.       ORDER BY ts_lexize(mapdict, parse.token) IS NULL, m.mapseqno
  361.       LIMIT 1
  362.     ) AS lexemes
  363. FROM ts_parse(
  364.         (SELECT cfgparser FROM pg_ts_config WHERE oid = $1 ), $2
  365.     ) AS parse,
  366.      ts_token_type(
  367.         (SELECT cfgparser FROM pg_ts_config WHERE oid = $1 )
  368.     ) AS tt
  369. WHERE tt.tokid = parse.tokid;
  370. END;

  372. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION ts_debug(document text,
  373.     OUT alias text,
  374.     OUT description text,
  375.     OUT token text,
  376.     OUT dictionaries regdictionary[],
  377.     OUT dictionary regdictionary,
  378.     OUT lexemes text[])
  379. RETURNS SETOF record
  380. LANGUAGE sql
  381. STABLE PARALLEL SAFE STRICT
  382. BEGIN ATOMIC
  383.     SELECT * FROM ts_debug(get_current_ts_config(), $1);
  384. END;

  417. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION pg_logical_slot_get_changes(
  418.     IN slot_name name, IN upto_lsn pg_lsn, IN upto_nchanges int, VARIADIC options text[] DEFAULT '{}',
  419.     OUT lsn pg_lsn, OUT xid xid, OUT data text)
  420. RETURNS SETOF RECORD
  421. LANGUAGE INTERNAL

  544. AS 'jsonb_path_match';

  546. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION
  547.   jsonb_path_query(target jsonb, path jsonpath, vars jsonb DEFAULT '{}',
  548.                    silent boolean DEFAULT false)
  549. RETURNS SETOF jsonb
  550. LANGUAGE INTERNAL
  551. STRICT IMMUTABLE PARALLEL SAFE
  552. AS 'jsonb_path_query';

  554. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION
  555.   jsonb_path_query_array(target jsonb, path jsonpath, vars jsonb DEFAULT '{}',
  556.                          silent boolean DEFAULT false)
  557. RETURNS jsonb
  558. LANGUAGE INTERNAL
  559. STRICT IMMUTABLE PARALLEL SAFE
  560. AS 'jsonb_path_query_array';

  562. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION
  563.   jsonb_path_query_first(target jsonb, path jsonpath, vars jsonb DEFAULT '{}',
  564.                          silent boolean DEFAULT false)
  565. RETURNS jsonb
  566. LANGUAGE INTERNAL
  567. STRICT IMMUTABLE PARALLEL SAFE
  568. AS 'jsonb_path_query_first';

  570. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION

  610. -- default normalization form is NFC, per SQL standard
  611. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION
  612.   "normalize"(text, text DEFAULT 'NFC')
  613. RETURNS text
  614. LANGUAGE internal
  615. STRICT IMMUTABLE PARALLEL SAFE
  616. AS 'unicode_normalize_func';

  618. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION
  619.   is_normalized(text, text DEFAULT 'NFC')
  620. RETURNS boolean
  621. LANGUAGE internal
  622. STRICT IMMUTABLE PARALLEL SAFE
  623. AS 'unicode_is_normalized';

  625. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION
  626.   pg_stat_reset_shared(target text DEFAULT NULL)
  627. RETURNS void
  628. LANGUAGE INTERNAL
  629. CALLED ON NULL INPUT VOLATILE PARALLEL SAFE
  630. AS 'pg_stat_reset_shared';

  632. ‌CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION
  633.   pg_stat_reset_slru(target text DEFAULT NULL)
  634. RETURNS void
  635. LANGUAGE INTERNAL
  636. CALLED ON NULL INPUT VOLATILE PARALLEL SAFE
  637. AS 'pg_stat_reset_slru';

  639. --
  640. -- The default permissions for functions mean that anyone can execute them.
  641. -- A number of functions shouldn't be executable by just anyone, but rather
  642. -- than use explicit 'superuser()' checks in those functions, we use the GRANT
  643. -- system to REVOKE access to those functions at initdb time.  Administrators
  644. -- can later change who can access these functions, or leave them as only
  645. -- available to superuser / cluster owner, if they choose.
  646. --

  648. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_backup_start(text, boolean) FROM public;

  650. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_backup_stop(boolean) FROM public;

  652. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_create_restore_point(text) FROM public;

  654. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_switch_wal() FROM public;

  656. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_log_standby_snapshot() FROM public;

  658. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_wal_replay_pause() FROM public;

  660. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_wal_replay_resume() FROM public;

  662. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_rotate_logfile() FROM public;

  664. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_reload_conf() FROM public;

  666. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_current_logfile() FROM public;

  668. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_current_logfile(text) FROM public;

  670. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_promote(boolean, integer) FROM public;

  672. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_stat_reset() FROM public;

  674. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_stat_reset_shared(text) FROM public;

  676. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_stat_reset_slru(text) FROM public;

  678. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_stat_reset_single_table_counters(oid) FROM public;

  680. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_stat_reset_single_function_counters(oid) FROM public;

  682. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_stat_reset_replication_slot(text) FROM public;

  684. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_stat_have_stats(text, oid, oid) FROM public;

  686. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_stat_reset_subscription_stats(oid) FROM public;

  688. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION lo_import(text) FROM public;

  690. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION lo_import(text, oid) FROM public;

  692. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION lo_export(oid, text) FROM public;

  694. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_logdir() FROM public;

  696. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_waldir() FROM public;

  698. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_archive_statusdir() FROM public;

  700. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_tmpdir() FROM public;

  702. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_tmpdir(oid) FROM public;

  704. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_read_file(text) FROM public;

  706. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_read_file(text,boolean) FROM public;

  708. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_read_file(text,bigint,bigint) FROM public;

  710. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_read_file(text,bigint,bigint,boolean) FROM public;

  712. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_read_binary_file(text) FROM public;

  714. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_read_binary_file(text,boolean) FROM public;

  716. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_read_binary_file(text,bigint,bigint) FROM public;

  718. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_read_binary_file(text,bigint,bigint,boolean) FROM public;

  720. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_replication_origin_advance(text, pg_lsn) FROM public;

  722. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_replication_origin_create(text) FROM public;

  724. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_replication_origin_drop(text) FROM public;

  726. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_replication_origin_oid(text) FROM public;

  734. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_replication_origin_session_reset() FROM public;

  736. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_replication_origin_session_setup(text) FROM public;

  738. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_replication_origin_xact_reset() FROM public;

  740. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_replication_origin_xact_setup(pg_lsn, timestamp with time zone) FROM public;

  742. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_show_replication_origin_status() FROM public;

  744. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_stat_file(text) FROM public;

  746. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_stat_file(text,boolean) FROM public;

  748. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_dir(text) FROM public;

  750. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_dir(text,boolean,boolean) FROM public;

  752. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_log_backend_memory_contexts(integer) FROM PUBLIC;

  754. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_logicalsnapdir() FROM PUBLIC;

  756. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_logicalmapdir() FROM PUBLIC;

  758. REVOKE EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_replslotdir(text) FROM PUBLIC;

  760. --
  761. -- We also set up some things as accessible to standard roles.
  762. --

  764. GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_logdir() TO pg_monitor;

  766. GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_waldir() TO pg_monitor;

  768. GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_archive_statusdir() TO pg_monitor;

  770. GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_tmpdir() TO pg_monitor;

  772. GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_tmpdir(oid) TO pg_monitor;

  774. GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_logicalsnapdir() TO pg_monitor;

  776. GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_logicalmapdir() TO pg_monitor;

  778. GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_ls_replslotdir(text) TO pg_monitor;

  780. GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_current_logfile() TO pg_monitor;

  782. GRANT EXECUTE ON FUNCTION pg_current_logfile(text) TO pg_monitor;

  784. GRANT pg_read_all_settings TO pg_monitor;

  786. GRANT pg_read_all_stats TO pg_monitor;

  788. GRANT pg_stat_scan_tables TO pg_monitor;
